div.p: This CapabilityStatement outlines the conformance requirements and expectations for Argonaut User Facing Patient List EHR Server. It identifies the specific profiles and RESTful transactions for requesting user facing patient list data from an EHR using the Argonaut User Facing Patient List API. This includes the following interactions:

ol.li: Discovery of User Facing Patient Lists
Fetching Additional Data about each Patient in a User Facing Patient Lists

div.p: This is a Requirements CapabilityStatement describing what capabilities are potentially relevant. It can be used as a template for creating an Instance CapabilityStatement by removing expectation extensions and making actual assertions associated with each capability to describe the capabilities of a deployed and configured Server.
div.h3: SHOULD Support the Following Implementation Guides:

li.a: HL7 FHIR® US Core Implementation Guide STU3 Release 3.1.1

ol.li: Support discovery of user facing patient lists
Support JSON source formats for all transactions
Declare a CapabilityStatement identifying the transactions and profiles supported
Support fetching additional data about each patient in a user facing patient lists
Support XML source formats for all transactions
See the US Core General Security Considerations section for requirements and recommendations.

td.a: Argonaut User Facing Patient List (Group) Profile

blockquote.p: For getting additional data about Group members, the Argonaut Patient List (Group) Profile support an extension on the Group.member element for directly accessing one or more Appointment resources for each patient on the patient list. The Server MAY supply this extension so that the Client can efficiently fetch the Appointment resource.

ul.li: MAY support create, vread, update, patch, delete, history-instance, history-type.
A Server SHOULD be capable of returning a Appointment resource using: GET [base]/Appointment/[id]

td.p: for fetching of additional appointment data about group members. The Server SHOULD support comma-separated values.

div.p: Supported Profiles: US Core Encounter Profile

blockquote.p: For getting additional data about Group members, the Argonaut Patient List (Group) Profile supports an extension on the Group.member element for directly accessing one or more Encounter resources for each patient on the patient list. The Server MAY supply this extension so that the Client can efficiently fetch the Encounter resource.

ul.li: MAY support create, vread, update, patch, delete, history-instance, history-type.
A Server SHOULD be capable of returning a Encounter resource using: GET [base]/Encounter/[id]

td.p: for fetching of additional encounter data about group members. The Server SHOULD support comma-separated values.

div.p: Supported Profiles: Argonaut User Facing Patient List (Group) Profile

blockquote.p: Required resource type for discovery and fetching of user facing lists. For getting additional data about Group members. The Server MAY supply one or more of these extensions:

li.a: Argonaut Patient List Member Appointment Extension
Argonaut Patient List Member Encounter Extension
Argonaut User Facing Patient List Questionnaire Extension
Argonaut User Facing Patient List Member QuestionnaireResponse Extension

ul.li: MAY support create, update, patch, delete, history-instance, history-type.

div.blockquote:
search-type†
Servers SHALL require the following search parameters and parameter values for discovery of user-facing lists:
_summary=“true"
type=“person”.
Servers SHALL include Group.characteristic in addition to all the standard Group summary elements.
Servers SHALL support discovering all available patient lists using the required parameter
Servers SHOULD support discovering all available patient lists managed by a particular organization or practitioner using the required parameters and the managing-entity search parameter.
Servers SHOULD support discovering all available patient lists that have a particular characteristic using the required parameters and the combination of characteristic and value-reference search parameters

read†
When the Patient list is too large be able to return a whole resource:
The Server SHOULD NOT return first-page results as described here
The Server SHOULD return an OperationOutcome indicating that the client needs to call the $getpageoperation to return a Group

ul.li: A Server SHALL be capable of returning a Group resource using: GET [base]/Group/[id]
A Server SHOULD be capable of supporting the following _includes: Group:member - GET [base]/Group?[parameter=value]&_include=Group:member

td.p: required search parameters and parameter value type=person for discovery of user-facing lists:
required search parameters and parameter value _summary=true for discovery of user-facing lists:
for discovery of user-facing lists managed by a particular organization or practitioner
for discovery of user-facing lists by a characteristic used in combination with value-reference
for discovery of user-facing lists by a characteristic used in combination with characteristic
the _include parameter can be used when fetching a Group resource to include all the Patient resources in addition to Group
for fetching of user facing lists

blockquote.p: For getting additional data about Group members, the Argonaut Patient List (Group) Profile supports 2 extension for directly accessing the Group level Questionnaire and the resultant pre-filled QuestionnaireResponse form for each patient on the patient list: The Server MAY supply this extension so that the Client can fetch the form definitions in the Questionnaire resource and the form data in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.

ul.li: MAY support create, vread, update, patch, delete, history-instance, history-type.
A Server SHOULD be capable of returning a Questionnaire resource using: GET [base]/Questionnaire/[id]

td.p: for fetching the definitions of associated data about group members represented in the Questionnaire resource. The Server SHOULD support comma-separated values.

blockquote.p: For getting additional data about Group members, the Argonaut Patient List (Group) Profile supports 2 extension for directly accessing the Group level Questionnaire and the resultant pre-filled QuestionnaireResponse form for each patient on the patient list: The Server MAY supply these extensions so that the Client can fetch the form definitions in the Questionnaire resource and the form data in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.

ul.li: MAY support create, vread, update, patch, delete, history-instance, history-type.
A Server SHOULD be capable of returning a QuestionnaireResponse resource using: GET [base]/QuestionnaireResponse/[id]

td.p: for fetching associated data about group members represented in the QuestionnaireResponse resource. The Server SHOULD support comma-separated values.

description.value:
This CapabilityStatement outlines the conformance requirements and expectations for Argonaut User Facing Patient List **EHR Server**. It identifies the specific profiles and RESTful transactions for requesting user facing patient list data from an EHR using the Argonaut User Facing Patient List API. This includes the following interactions:
1. Discovery of User Facing Patient Lists 2. Fetching User Facing Patient Lists 3. Fetching Additional Data about each Patient in a User Facing Patient Lists
This is a [Requirements CapabilityStatement](http://hl7.org/fhir/capabilitystatement.html#requirements) describing what capabilities are potentially relevant. It can be used as a template for creating an [Instance CapabilityStatement](http://hl7.org/fhir/capabilitystatement.html#instance) by removing expectation extensions and making actual assertions associated with each capability to describe the capabilities of a deployed and configured Server.

documentation.value:
The Server **SHALL**:
1. Support discovery of user facing patient lists 1. Support fetching user facing lists 1. Support JSON source formats for all transactions 1. Declare a CapabilityStatement identifying the transactions and profiles supported
The Server **SHOULD**:
1. Support fetching additional data about each patient in a user facing patient lists 1. Support XML source formats for all transactions

description.value: 1. See the [US Core General Security Considerations](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/security.html) section for requirements and recommendations.

documentation.value: For getting additional data about Group members, the Argonaut Patient List (Group) Profile support an extension on the `Group.member` element for directly accessing one or more Appointment resources for each patient on the patient list. The Server **MAY** supply this extension so that the Client can efficiently fetch the Appointment resource.
for fetching of additional appointment data about group members. The Server **SHOULD** support comma-separated values.

For getting additional data about Group members, the Argonaut Patient List (Group) Profile supports an extension on the `Group.member` element for directly accessing one or more Encounter resources for each patient on the patient list. The Server **MAY** supply this extension so that the Client can efficiently fetch the Encounter resource.
for fetching of additional encounter data about group members. The Server **SHOULD** support comma-separated values.

Required resource type for discovery and fetching of user facing lists. For getting additional data about Group members. The Server **MAY** supply one or more of these extensions:
1. [Argonaut Patient List Member Appointment Extension](https://argonautproject.github.io/patient-lists/StructureDefinition-patientlist-appointment.html#profile) 1. [Argonaut Patient List Member Encounter Extension](https://argonautproject.github.io/patient-lists/StructureDefinition-patientlist-encounter.html#profile) 1. [Argonaut User Facing Patient List Questionnaire Extension](https://argonautproject.github.io/patient-lists/StructureDefinition-patientlist-questionnaire.html#profile) 1. [Argonaut User Facing Patient List Member QuestionnaireResponse Extension](https://argonautproject.github.io/patient-lists/StructureDefinition-patientlist-questionnaireresponse.html#profile)

1. Servers **SHALL** require the following search parameters and parameter values for discovery of user-facing lists: - _summary=“true" - type=“person”. 1. Servers **SHALL** include `Group.characteristic` *in addition to* all the standard Group summary elements. 1. Servers **SHALL** support discovering all available patient lists using the required parameter 1. Servers **SHOULD** support discovering all available patient lists managed by a particular organization or practitioner using the required parameters and the `managing-entity` search parameter. 1. Servers **SHOULD** support discovering all available patient lists that have a particular characteristic using the required parameters and the combination of `characteristic` and `value-reference` search parameters

When the Patient list is too large be able to return a whole resource: - The Server **SHOULD NOT** return first-page results as described [here](http://hl7.org/fhir/search.html#count) - The Server **SHOULD** return an *OperationOutcome* indicating that the client needs to call the `$getpage`operation to return a Group
required search parameters and parameter value ` type=person` for discovery of user-facing lists:
required search parameters and parameter value ` _summary=true` for discovery of user-facing lists:
for discovery of user-facing lists managed by a particular organization or practitioner
for discovery of user-facing lists by a characteristic used in combination with `value-reference`
for discovery of user-facing lists by a characteristic used in combination with `characteristic`
the `_include` parameter can be used when fetching a Group resource to include all the Patient resources in addition to Group
for fetching of user facing lists

For getting additional data about Group members, the Argonaut Patient List (Group) Profile supports 2 extension for directly accessing the Group level Questionnaire and the resultant pre-filled QuestionnaireResponse form for each patient on the patient list: The Server **MAY** supply this extension so that the Client can fetch the form definitions in the Questionnaire resource and the form data in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.
for fetching the definitions of associated data about group members represented in the Questionnaire resource. The Server **SHOULD** support comma-separated values.

For getting additional data about Group members, the Argonaut Patient List (Group) Profile supports 2 extension for directly accessing the Group level Questionnaire and the resultant pre-filled QuestionnaireResponse form for each patient on the patient list: The Server **MAY** supply these extensions so that the Client can fetch the form definitions in the Questionnaire resource and the form data in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.
for fetching associated data about group members represented in the QuestionnaireResponse resource. The Server **SHOULD** support comma-separated values.
The Server **SHOULD** support transaction interactions to Getting Additional Data About Group Members
The Server **SHOULD** support batch interactions to Getting Additional Data About Group Members
